Setting.name: SwitchString
Setting.Description: A switch flag setting string. Ex: "CPVER:[1] ACEN DCEN FHRST" Detail parameter please reference following table. Parameter | Description -------------+---------------------------------------------- PTEN | All protection enable. PTDIS | All protection disable. ACEN | AC protect checking enable. ACDIS | AC protect checking disable. DCEN | DC & Gangue protect checking enable. DCDIS | DC & Gangue protect checking disable. RESSEN | BIOS Regression enable. RESSDIS | BIOS Regression disable. PJMDEN | Project Model string protect checking enable. PJMDDIS | Project Model string protect checking disable. FHOS | System back to OS after flash BIOS completely. FHST | System directly shutdown after flash BIOS completely. FHRST | System directly reboot after flash BIOS completely. CPVER:[Num] | Common Flash Version information -------------+----------------------------------------------

Setting.name: ErrorMsg10
Setting.default: Not support this version of Flash Common Interface!

Setting.name: ErrorMsg11
Setting.default: Show BIOS version string length more than xx bytes.

Setting.name: ErrorMsg12
Setting.default: Show model name string length more than xx bytes.

Setting.name: ErrorMsg[Num]
Setting.Description: ErrorMsg##=[Message String] The number of ErrorMsg## is in hex.

Settings.name: PermitFlashConditionalData
Settings.caption: Permit Flash Conditional Data
Settings.Description: This feature will pass conditional setting to BIOS and get compare result from BIOS. Only when the result is failure, flash process will be terminated.

Setting.name: PFCDFunctionEnable
Setting.caption: Enable Permit Flash Conditional Check
Setting.Description: If the flag is disabled, application will keep flash progress without conditional check.

Setting.name: Conditionalcount
Setting.caption: Conditional Data Count
Setting.Description: Total count of conditional data.

Setting.name: Conditionaldata1
Setting.default: 1,w,0003,The BIOS image does not support the current hardware configuration.\nFlash update is aborted.

Setting.name: Conditionaldata2
Setting.default: 2,w,20DD,The BIOS image does not support the current hardware configuration.\nFlash update is aborted.

Setting.name: Conditionaldata3
Setting.default: 2,w,20DE,The BIOS image does not support the current hardware configuration.\nFlash update is aborted.

Setting.name: Conditionaldata[Num]
Setting.Description: Conditionaldata#=[Data Type], [Data Format], [Data Field], [Message String] Base on data format you need and to add configure value by below data format field and data field. Conditionaldata# : # support from 1~20. [Data Type] : The type of Conditionaldata, when you have more than one conditional data need to check before flash, you can give them different type. It will allow flash when all types are pass. It also can use the same type with more than one conditional data, that means if one of the conditional data is pass, this type is pass. Ex: We have the following settings, Conditionaldata1 is type 0, others are type 1. Conditionalcount=3 Conditionaldata1=0,w,"0x1234","This BIOS is not allow to flash." Conditionaldata2=1,w,"0x1111","This BIOS is not allow to flash." Conditionaldata3=1,w,"0x1222","This BIOS is not allow to flash." When Conditionaldata1 is pass and Conditionaldata2 or Conditionaldata 3 is pass that will allow flash. Allow = data1 pass && ( data2 pass || data3 pass ). [Data Format] : Can support different as binary, string, WORD, DWORD. b : The data format is binary. s : The data format is string. w : The data format is WORD. d : The data format is DWORD. [Data Field] : Relative data base on data format. BINARY : If the data format is binary. Data field is HEX. The data is as like "AA BB 00 12 55". String : If the data format is string. Data field is string. The data is as like "Data.123.AABE.". WORD : If the data format is WORD. Data field is HEX and unit is a WORD length. The data is as like "0x1223". DWORD : If the data format is DWORD. Data field is HEX and unit is a DWORD length. The data is as like "0x12345678". [Message string] : Define customize message string here. The message is pop up when flash utility get a process interrupted from BIOS. The message string is optional field. It will not pop any message if you do not provide message string in this field.

Setting.name: FD#[Num]
Setting.Description: FD#XX (dwsDWS) Integer : XX is decimal number from 01 to 99. (FD#01 ~ FD#99) This section supports IO space type, PCI address type and multiple condition type. FD#XX=IO,[Offset],[Mask],[Value],[Filename],[ME Filename],[INI Filename] FD#XX=PCI,[Bus],[Device],[Function],[Offset],[Mask],[Value],[Filename],[ME Filename],[INI Filename] FD#XX=MPCIIO,[Condition Number],PCI-[Bus]-[Device]-[Function]-[Offset]-[Mask]-[Value],IO-[Offset]-[Mask]-[Value],[Filename],[ME Filename],[INI Filename] FD#XX=ID,[Model Name],[Filename],[ME Filename],[INI Filename] FD#XX=OS,[OS Version],[Filename],[ME Filename],[INI Filename] FD#XX=MEMORY,[Physical Address],[Mask],[Value],[Filename],[ME Filename],[INI Filename] (dwsDWS) [Offset] : Offset in hex. (dwsDWS) [Mask] : IO type supports BYTE, WORD and DWORD in hex. For example, BYTE -> 03, WORD -> 0A01, DWORD 100400D3 PCI type supports DWORD in hex only. MEMORY type supports BYTE, WORD and DWORD in hex. (dwsDWS) [Value] : IO type supports BYTE, WORD and DWORD in hex. PCI type supports DWORD in hex only. MEMORY type supports BYTE, WORD and DWORD in hex. (dwsDWS) [Model Name] : The platform ID, model name string. (wW) [OS Version] : 32bit or 64bit OS. 32 for 32bit OS, 64 for 64bit OS. (dws) [Physical Address] : A DWORD value in hex. (dwsDWS) [Filename] : Filename of FD. (w) [ME Filename] : ME Filename of FD. If it exists, flash utility will run OEMME flash feature. (dw) [INI Filename] : INI Filename for overwrite. If it exists, flash utility will load the new ini file and overwrite all sections (except [MULTI_FD]) exist in new ini file. When [Offset] & [Mask] == [Value], it will flash the following files ([Filename] and [ME Filename]).

Setting.name: Version
Setting.Description: It will be show on UI, and append on current version number. When current version is 5.01 and this version string set to "12", then it will show "H2OFFT V5.01.12" on main dialog caption.

Setting.name: Silent
Setting.Description: 0 : Normal mode. 1 : Silent mode. The dialog display behavior is base on "SilentWithDialog" setting.

Setting.name: SilentWithDialog
Setting.Description: 0 : Don't display any dialog. 1 : Display main dialog only. 2 : Display all dialogs except main dialog.

Setting.name: GetFDFileButton
Setting.caption: Show the button for browsing FD file

Setting.name: ConfirmInfo
Setting.caption: Display BIOS version and build date

Setting.name: ConfirmInfoRDate
Setting.caption: Display BIOS version and release date
Setting.Description: When this flag set to 1, the ConfirmInfo flag won't be referenced.

Setting.name: ConfirmDialogCustomizeMessage
Setting.Description: For inserting additional notification message in confirm dialog.

Setting.name: BeforeRunToolDelayTime
Setting.caption: Delay number of seconds before flash utility running

Setting.name: DelayBeforeFlash
Setting.caption: Delay number of seconds before flashing

Setting.name: DisableMouseAndKeyboardInput
Setting.caption: Disable Mouse and Keyboard Input
Setting.Description: When this flag is set, the mouse and keyboard will no function except "CTRL+ALT+DEL".

Setting.name: ProgramStartToWrongMessageBox
Setting.caption: Pop-up Warning Dialog Before Flash Process

Setting.name: DisableAccessRightWarningMessage
Setting.caption: Disable Access Right Warning Dialog
Setting.Description: No : It will show warning message when any region is locked (such as ME) in input image. Yes : Do not show warning message when any region is locked in input image.

Setting.name: ShowUpdateROMAddress
Setting.caption: Show ROM address when updating BIOS
Setting.Description: No : Show progress bar when updating BIOS. Yes : Show ROM address when updating BIOS.

Setting.name: Elapse
Setting.caption: Show elapse time during progressing BIOS update

Setting.name: Flag
Setting.Description: Options include: * Auto flash mode * User option mode, including option, start, exit buttons. (Option button will disable on secure flash mode.) * User flash mode, including start, exit buttons

Setting.name: FileName
Setting.Description: When this field is not empty, flash utility will always load this file. If the FileName is empty and Multi FD feature not enable, flash utility will search current directory and load the first found FD file.

Setting.name: BatteryBound
Setting.caption: Battery Bound
Setting.Description: Low battery boundary (percentage)\nWhen BatteryCheck=1 this value will be referenced, and only when the battery life percentage is bigger than inputed value, it can do flash.

Setting.name: Flag
Setting.Description: This flag is the switch of comparing bios project ID with ROM file project ID. 0 : Don't check project ID. 1 : Check project ID of new file. If ID is different with current BIOS, the utility will close. 2 : Utility will compare current platform ID with the PlatformName1 ~ PlatformName20 IDs. If any one is match, it will go ahead, otherwise utility will close. 3 : Depends on BIOS report to check or not check project ID.

Settings.name: PlatformVersion
Settings.caption: Platform Version
Settings.Description: Valid only when [Platform_Check.Flag] is "Flash if any one is matched". The Version is pair with the PlatformName. For example: When the platform ID matches with PlatformName2, the Version2 will be used.

Setting.name: Flag
Setting.Description: Disable : Don't use multi version. Enable : Use the version in the list instead of the version in file.

Setting.name: CheckByBiosErrorMessage
Setting.default: This BIOS file is not allow to flash. The flash process will be terminated.

Setting.name: VersionFormat
Setting.Description: X : The field is masked. It will NOT be compared N : The digit field can be ASCII, case-sensitive T : It's the same definition with N. But T is a case-insensitive . : Dot is also a mask. It will NOT be compared D : Don't care field. It will NOT be compared This field can be empty. It only allow to put at start or end of the version format. For example: Onboard version 1.21B flash to 1.22, VersionFormat must be N.NNDN.NND means the valid format is N.NN and N.NNX, the 5th character will be ignore in version compare.

Settings.name: PermitFlashVersion
Settings.caption: Permit Flash Version
Settings.Description:
This section is for conditional version definition for BIOS update.
When this function enabled, flash utility will compare on board BIOS version with conditional version and then decide to continue flash progress or not. For example: In following condition PFVFunctionEnable=1, SingleVersion=A03, "Please update to BIOS version A03 first!". When on board BIOS version is older than A03, it will popup the error dialog with the message "Please upate to BIOS version A03 first!" and then terminated. Otherwise it will continue orginal flash process. The MultiVersion1~20 are similar as SingleVersion, but they only available when the [Platform_Check] is enable to compare the 20 platform IDs. They must be pair of the PlatformName of [Platform_Check] section. For example: When the platform ID matches with PlatformName2, the Version2 will be used. The section is depended on other sections if using [PermitFlashVersion]. a. If single version is enabled, Please also configure section [Bios_Version_Check] for version check b. If multi-version is enabled, Please also configure following sections [Bios_Version_Check] for version check, section [Platform_Check] for platform name check and section [PlatformVersion] for multi-platform version check

Setting.name: SingleVersion
Setting.Description: Format : XXXX, "Message String" XXXX is the conditional version, regarding version check rule please refer section "BIOSVersionFormat". "Message String" is the message to show when the on board BIOS version is older than the conditional version.

Setting.name: MultiVersion1
Setting.Description: Format : XXXX, "Message String" XXXX is the conditional version, regarding version check rule please refer section "BIOSVersionFormat". "Message String" is the message to show when the on board BIOS version is older than the conditional version.

Setting.Description: Format : XXXX, "Message String" XXXX is the conditional version, regarding version check rule please refer section "BIOSVersionFormat". "Message String" is the message to show when the on board BIOS version is older than the conditional version.

Setting.name: Counter
Setting.caption: Number of seconds for count down to reboot or shutdown

Setting.name: ActionOverride
Setting.Description: Yes : Flash utility bases action key setting to do original behavior. No : Flash utility just does close itself in silent mode.

Setting.name: PauseWarning
Setting.Description: A key name which list in [MessageStringTable]

Setting.name: EnableFlashSecureBIOSOverride
Setting.Description: Disable : Use the action which returned from BIOS. Enable : Enable the action override when flashing secure BIOS in OS.

Settings.name: ForceFlash
Settings.Description: These areas are reported by IHISI from BIOS for protection. When you set the value to 1, the selected protect area will be force flash. BB_PEI, CPU_Microcode, Variable, DXE, EC, Password, OEM_NVS and Logo are the predefined types each one indicate a type value. BB_PEI = Type#00 CPU_Microcode = Type#01 Variable = Type#02 DXE = Type#03 EC = Type#04 Password = Type#0F OEM_NVS = Type#10 Logo = Type#05 Type#NN is an extended method for those didnâ€™t have predefine type. The NN is a number in Hex. For example: If BIOS report to protect type 13h from IHISI, and you want to flash this protect area. Then the setting in platform.ini can add Type#13=1.

Settings.name: Region
Settings.Description: Used to control SPI descriptor mode. Default is flash all regions when the values all set to 'No'. If any one of the regions set to 'Yes', it will only flash specific region. If the BIOS is built without additional Intel firmware as like ME, GBE and Descriptor or BIOS is an AMD firmware which does not support ME, please ignore this section.

Setting.name: BIOS_Only
Setting.caption: Only flash BIOS part of the merged file

Setting.name: EC_Compare
Setting.caption: Read EC and compare difference before writing

Settings.name: UpdateExtraData
Settings.Description: This feature will let you just input data to update by IHISI. Data type is defined by BIOS OEM. If input image is NOT processed by IFIT tool, please do not enable this function.

Setting.name: Flag
Setting.caption: Update extra data
Setting.Description: If input image is NOT processed by IFIT tool, please do not enable this function.

Setting.name: DataType
Setting.Description: The meaning of data type number is defined by BIOS OEM. Current support data range is 1 and 4 ~ C. Ex:1,4,6,5 -> Means you want to update 1,4,6,5 four types of data. Notice: 2 and 3 cannot be used.

Setting.name: type1errorcodeA0
Setting.Description: This key is for customizing error message which occur in update extra data.

Setting.name: type[Num]errorcode[Ret]
Setting.Description: This key is for customizing error message which occur in update extra data. For example: When an error occur when updating type 4, BIOS return the error code A2. AP will find the key "type4errorcodeA2" and get the string ID "messagestring4", and find the string in [MessageStringTable]. Then shows the message string instead of standard error message. # : The the type number define in DataType. (Hex) ?? : The error code returned by BIOS. Available value range A0~AF. X : Message string number.

Settings.name: UpdateOEMME
Settings.Description: NOTE: The Intel firmware update tool (FWUpdLcl.exe) is dependent on each chipset generation, the tool in release flash package is a sample and may be not suitable for your project. Please remember to replace the FWUpdLcl.exe file with right version before you will utilize function to update Intel firmware (ME or TXE).

Setting.name: MEFileName
Setting.Description: If the filename in this field or Multi-FD ME filename exist flash utility will use Intel ME update tool to flash ME.

Setting.name: Command
Setting.Description: When this field is empty and don't want to check ME version, utility will use "-f %filename -generic -allowsv" as default command. The %filename is a keyword which will be replaced with the value in MEFileName within this section or the filename in MULTI_FD section.

Setting.name: DisableCompare
Setting.Description: When not disable compare, it will read BIOS and compare difference before writing. If the read data is the same as the data we want to write, it will not do the write action. When disable compare, it will do write action directly.

Setting.name: DisableVerify
Setting.Description: When not disable verify, it will read back the write block from BIOS and compare difference after writing. If the read data is NOT the same as the data we write, it will display error. When disable verify, it will skip verify action.

Setting.name: VerifyErrorRetry
Setting.Description: How many times should flash utility retry when write data is mismatch in verify action. If the value is not zero means enable verify retry, and will retry setted times. 0 for disable verify retry.

Setting.name: SMIErrorRetryDelay
Setting.Description: Delay time (millisecond) during SMI error retry.

Setting.name: SMIErrorRetry
Setting.Description: Retry times when SMI fail. Note: This may let flash time become longer.

Setting.name: ForceIHISIVersion
Setting.Description: This setting will force override the IHISI version which will passing to BIOS. Ex: 1.9.1

Setting.name: EnablePrivateRegionMovement
Setting.Description: When enable private region movement, it will backup onboard private regions and relocate to new address which defined in input image BVDT when update whole BIOS.

Setting.name: EnableProtectionRegionMovement
Setting.Description: When enable protection region movement, it will backup onboard protection regions and relocate to new address which defined in input image BVDT when update whole BIOS. This flag cannot be used with [ForceFlash] all=1.

Setting.name: DisableSecureCapsuleFlash
Setting.Description: When this feature disabled, it will only allow to flash normal BIOS on normal platform, and flash secure capsule (signed BIOS) on secure platform. When this feature enabled, it allows to flash normal BIOS on normal platform, and flash secure capsule (signed BIOS) on secure and normal platform.

Setting.name: MsgSuccess
Setting.caption: Success Message
Setting.Description: The string displayed when the comparing result returned by BIOS is 0x00.

Setting.name: MsgFailure
Setting.caption: Failure Message
Setting.default: Password is incorrect. Please retry again.
Setting.Description: The string displayed when the comparing result returned by BIOS is 0x01.

Setting.name: messagestringA00
Setting.default: It only supports to flash secure BIOS on current platform.\r\nThe image to be updated is not a secure BIOS.\r\n

Setting.name: messagestringA01
Setting.default: Not allow to flash secure BIOS on current platform.\r\n

Setting.name: messagestringA02
Setting.default: Please do not remove the AC power!

Setting.name: messagestring[Num]
Setting.Description: The message string must as following format messagestring#="Your message here." The # is a number in Decimal or Hex. If a multi line message is required, you can use "\ n" in message string for new line.

Settings.name: FactoryCopy
Settings.Description: Factory copy is a region in BIOS which is used to store default keys of Secure Boot.

Setting.name: QAKey
Setting.Description: Image file signing by Insyde QA test key.

Setting.name: OemKey
Setting.Description: Image file signing by OEM/ODM key.

Setting.name: viaESP
Setting.caption: Write the capsule to ESP
Setting.Description: When enable, secure capsule will only copy to ESP (EFI system partition). When disable, secure capsule will pass via IHISI.

Setting.name: Flag
Setting.caption: Enable auto power on via RTC

Setting.name: Interval
Setting.caption: Interval (sec)
Setting.Description: Unit is second. Interval time after system turn off.

Item.caption: Display all dialogs except main dialog
Display all dialogs except main dialog
Check project ID of new file
Flash if any one is matched
Display dialog and wait several seconds
When ME update error is caused by same or downgrade version, do not show error and continue to flash
When ME update error, show error but continue to flash
